result.execSummary:
The defendant Connor N Fitzpatrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for out of State transfer through the Interstate Compact.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction.  Condition time with release date of 10-12-2017 with release for treatment at Waukesha County Health and Human Services and work.
Request for Conditional Time filed by Department of Corrections.

ADDRESS INFO for Connor N Fitzpatrick
Current: 1199 North Shorewood Lane, Caryville, TN 37714-3708 United States  (Effective: 12-28-2016)
Prior: 127 Westminster Dr, Waukesha, WI 53186
Packet of Treatment and Character Letters, received and filed in court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Connor N Fitzpatrick in court with attorney Michael Reyes.


State orally amends the charge from a Class H Felony to a Class I Felony.
Defense has no objections.
Court directs the State file an amended information by: 04/20/16.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Defendant's mother presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
WITHHELD SENTENCE;

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
Court will allow for out of State transfer through the interstate compact.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
45 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at the agents discretion.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
